channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bridleway to stream and passing bay fenced off by developer, 30th September
item.description:
The bridleway to the stream and the entire vehicle lay-by (for 8+ vehicles and the whole of the right-angle triangle area in green) and vehicle passing bay were fenced off by the new house developer: The newly fenced vehicle passing bay is too small and often used as a car park, leaving not enough space for vehicles to pass. Previously the former passing bay and parking space area was huge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pheasant Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General road markings, lines and stud issues problem, 30th September
item.description:
Regarding the urgent need for white-lining, the ‘traffic island in the middle of the village’ is the traffic island at the junction of the village street with the lane which connects the village with the A40. I have to say there was nearly an accident there a few days ago, when a car coming into the village had to brake violently at this point to avoid colliding with another which was approaching on the wrong side of the road; (linked to 11494788)
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: The walkway/path leading from King Arthur Close into Cox's Meadow has sinkage due to excessive water run off, when drain blocks., 30th September
item.description:
Flat 1 Sandringham Court, I have spoken to Severn Trent and it is NOT their drainage system. I saw the Ringway driver who was unsure if it is responsibility of CBC or GCC? He does not have a MAP as a Contractor!! The issue is the sinkage appears to have caused a weakness in our boundary wall. I need someone please to contact me on 07775693738 in the first instance so I can meet on site if this IS your responsibility please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, King Arthur Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Dip in road, 29th September
item.description:
This is not a pothole. Instead, the road has a considerable dip in it. This is where the speed limit is 60 mph, so at that speed, the car has a significant bounce when driving over it. The dip is the whole width of the road, but it is worse when travelling north.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth Bypass, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dark corner as street light is engulfed in tree, 29th September
item.description:
1 The Greenings, Hatherley (Rental property) I have reported this 2 months ago, someone came to look but their ladder wasn’t suitable so it has been left This issue has been ongoing for the last couple of years! Please rectify this issue promptly. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, The Greenings, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
